text: Waterproofing membrane (sheet/applied/spray) type and thickness as per approved submittal
Drainage board, protection board, primers, and termination bars match drawings/spec
Materials stored upright, dry, and protected from damage/UV per manufacturer guidelines
Concrete cured min. 7 days (for sheet/spray membranes), clean, dry, and free of honeycombs, laitance
Wall tie holes patched; transitions between wall/footing filleted or reinforced
Membrane installed continuous, with shingle overlap at seams (min. 75 mm / 3")
All penetrations (pipes, rebar dowels, electrical) sealed with boots or compatible detail
Drainage board installed without puncturing membrane, overlaps secured
Filter fabric overlaps as per drawing (typically 100 mm)
Termination bar and sealant applied where required
System visually inspected for blisters, tears, or fish mouths
Damaged areas repaired with patches extending minimum 150 mm past defect
QA/QC inspection completed and signed off prior to backfilling

id: • CSA A123.3, CAN/CGSB-37.58 – Sheet Applied Membrane Systems
• Manufacturer Specifications (e.g., Blueskin, Bituthene, Tremco, Soprema)
